\title{Colour - Demosaicing Documentation}
\date{Feb 19, 2018}
\release{0.1.3}
\author{Colour Developers}
\newcommand{\sphinxlogo}{\sphinxincludegraphics{Logo_Medium_001.png}\par}
\renewcommand{\releasename}{Release}
\makeindex

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\sphinxtableofcontents
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{Demosaicing_001}.png}

A \sphinxhref{https://www.python.org/}{Python} package implementing various
CFA (Colour Filter Array) demosaicing algorithms and related utilities.

It is open source and freely available under the
\sphinxhref{http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause}{New BSD License} terms.


\chapter{Features}
\label{\detokenize{index:colour-demosaicing}}\label{\detokenize{index:features}}
The following CFA (Colour Filter Array) demosaicing algorithms are implemented:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Bilinear

\item {} 
Malvar (2004)

\item {} 
DDFAPD - Menon (2007)

\end{itemize}


\chapter{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{index:installation}}
Because of their size, the resources dependencies needed to run the various
examples and unit tests are not provided within the Pypi package. They are
separately available as
\sphinxhref{https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Submodules}{Git Submodules}
when cloning the
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour-demosaicing}{repository}.


\section{Primary Dependencies}
\label{\detokenize{index:primary-dependencies}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Colour - Demosaicing} requires various dependencies in order to run:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{https://www.python.org/download/releases/}{Python 2.7} or
\sphinxhref{https://www.python.org/download/releases/}{Python 3.5}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{http://www.numpy.org/}{NumPy}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/OpenImageIO/oiio}{OpenImageIO}

\end{itemize}


\section{Pypi}
\label{\detokenize{index:pypi}}
Once the dependencies satisfied, \sphinxstylestrong{Colour - Demosaicing} can be installed from
the \sphinxhref{http://pypi.python.org/pypi/colour-demosaicing}{Python Package Index} by
issuing this command in a shell:

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{colour}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{demosaicing}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The tests suite dependencies are installed as follows:

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{colour\PYGZhy{}demosaicing[tests]}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The documentation building dependencies are installed as follows:

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{colour\PYGZhy{}demosaicing[docs]}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subparagraph{Demosaicing}
\label{\detokenize{colour_demosaicing.bayer:demosaicing}}
\sphinxcode{colour\_demosaicing}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxatlongtablestart\begin{longtable}{p{0.5\linewidth}p{0.5\linewidth}}

\endfirsthead

{\makebox[0pt]{\sphinxtablecontinued{\tablename\ \thetable{} -- continued from previous page}}}\\
\hline

\endhead

\hline
\multicolumn{2}{r}{\makebox[0pt][r]{\sphinxtablecontinued{Continued on next page}}}\\
\endfoot

\endlastfoot

{\hyperref[\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_bilinear:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_bilinear}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_bilinear}}}}(CFA{[}, pattern{]})
&
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using bilinear interpolation.
\\
\hline
{\hyperref[\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Malvar2004:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Malvar2004}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Malvar2004}}}}(CFA{[}, pattern{]})
&
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using \sphinxstyleemphasis{Malvar (2004)} demosaicing algorithm.
\\
\hline
{\hyperref[\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Menon2007:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Menon2007}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Menon2007}}}}(CFA{[}, …{]})
&
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using DDFAPD - \sphinxstyleemphasis{Menon (2007)} demosaicing algorithm.
\\
\hline
\end{longtable}\sphinxatlongtableend\end{savenotes}


\subparagraph{colour\_demosaicing.demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_bilinear}
\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_bilinear::doc}}\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_bilinear:colour-demosaicing-demosaicing-cfa-bayer-bilinear}}\index{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_bilinear() (in module colour\_demosaicing)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_bilinear:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_bilinear}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{colour\_demosaicing.}\sphinxbfcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_bilinear}}{\emph{CFA}, \emph{pattern=u'RGGB'}}{}
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using
bilinear interpolation.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{CFA} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{array\_like}) \textendash{} \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{pattern} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{unicode}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{, }\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{optional}) \textendash{} \sphinxstylestrong{\{‘RGGB’, ‘BGGR’, ‘GRBG’, ‘GBRG’\}},
Arrangement of the colour filters on the pixel array.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}
\paragraph{Notes}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The definition output is not clipped in range {[}0, 1{]} : this allows for
direct HDRI / radiance image generation on \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA data and post
demosaicing of the high dynamic range data as showcased in this
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour-hdri/blob/develop/colour\_hdri/examples/examples\_merge\_from\_raw\_files\_with\_post\_demosaicing.ipynb}{Jupyter Notebook}.

\end{itemize}
\paragraph{References}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_bilinear:id1}}{\hyperref[\detokenize{bibliography:losson2010c}]{\sphinxcrossref{{[}LMY10{]}}}}

\end{itemize}

\subparagraph{colour\_demosaicing.demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Malvar2004}
\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Malvar2004:colour-demosaicing-demosaicing-cfa-bayer-malvar2004}}\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Malvar2004::doc}}\index{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Malvar2004() (in module colour\_demosaicing)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Malvar2004:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Malvar2004}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{colour\_demosaicing.}\sphinxbfcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Malvar2004}}{\emph{CFA}, \emph{pattern=u'RGGB'}}{}
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using
\sphinxstyleemphasis{Malvar (2004)} demosaicing algorithm.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{CFA} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{array\_like}) \textendash{} \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{pattern} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{unicode}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{, }\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{optional}) \textendash{} \sphinxstylestrong{\{‘RGGB’, ‘BGGR’, ‘GRBG’, ‘GBRG’\}},
Arrangement of the colour filters on the pixel array.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}
\paragraph{Notes}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The definition output is not clipped in range {[}0, 1{]} : this allows for
direct HDRI / radiance image generation on \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA data and post
demosaicing of the high dynamic range data as showcased in this
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour-hdri/blob/develop/colour\_hdri/examples/examples\_merge\_from\_raw\_files\_with\_post\_demosaicing.ipynb}{Jupyter Notebook}.

\end{itemize}
\paragraph{References}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Malvar2004:id1}}{\hyperref[\detokenize{bibliography:malvar2004a}]{\sphinxcrossref{{[}MHCW04{]}}}}

\end{itemize}

\subparagraph{colour\_demosaicing.demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Menon2007}
\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Menon2007:colour-demosaicing-demosaicing-cfa-bayer-menon2007}}\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Menon2007::doc}}\index{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Menon2007() (in module colour\_demosaicing)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Menon2007:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_Menon2007}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{colour\_demosaicing.}\sphinxbfcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_Menon2007}}{\emph{CFA}, \emph{pattern=u'RGGB'}, \emph{refining\_step=True}}{}
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using
DDFAPD - \sphinxstyleemphasis{Menon (2007)} demosaicing algorithm.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{CFA} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{array\_like}) \textendash{} \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{pattern} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{unicode}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{, }\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{optional}) \textendash{} \sphinxstylestrong{\{‘RGGB’, ‘BGGR’, ‘GRBG’, ‘GBRG’\}},
Arrangement of the colour filters on the pixel array.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{refining\_step} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{bool}}) \textendash{} Perform refining step.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}
\paragraph{Notes}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The definition output is not clipped in range {[}0, 1{]} : this allows for
direct HDRI / radiance image generation on \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA data and post
demosaicing of the high dynamic range data as showcased in this
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour-hdri/blob/develop/colour\_hdri/examples/examples\_merge\_from\_raw\_files\_with\_post\_demosaicing.ipynb}{Jupyter Notebook}.

\end{itemize}
\paragraph{References}
\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxstylestrong{Ancillary Objects}

\sphinxcode{colour\_demosaicing}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxatlongtablestart\begin{longtable}{p{0.5\linewidth}p{0.5\linewidth}}

{\hyperref[\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_DDFAPD:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_DDFAPD}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_DDFAPD}}}}(CFA{[}, pattern, …{]})
&
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using DDFAPD - \sphinxstyleemphasis{Menon (2007)} demosaicing algorithm.
\\
\hline
\end{longtable}\sphinxatlongtableend\end{savenotes}


\subparagraph{colour\_demosaicing.demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_DDFAPD}
\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_DDFAPD:colour-demosaicing-demosaicing-cfa-bayer-ddfapd}}\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_DDFAPD::doc}}\index{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_DDFAPD() (in module colour\_demosaicing)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_DDFAPD:colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_DDFAPD}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{colour\_demosaicing.}\sphinxbfcode{demosaicing\_CFA\_Bayer\_DDFAPD}}{\emph{CFA}, \emph{pattern=u'RGGB'}, \emph{refining\_step=True}}{}
Returns the demosaiced \sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array from given \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA using
DDFAPD - \sphinxstyleemphasis{Menon (2007)} demosaicing algorithm.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{CFA} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{array\_like}) \textendash{} \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{pattern} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{unicode}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{, }\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{optional}) \textendash{} \sphinxstylestrong{\{‘RGGB’, ‘BGGR’, ‘GRBG’, ‘GBRG’\}},
Arrangement of the colour filters on the pixel array.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{refining\_step} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{bool}}) \textendash{} Perform refining step.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{RGB} colourspace array.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}
\paragraph{Notes}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
The definition output is not clipped in range {[}0, 1{]} : this allows for
direct HDRI / radiance image generation on \sphinxstyleemphasis{Bayer} CFA data and post
demosaicing of the high dynamic range data as showcased in this
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour-hdri/blob/develop/colour\_hdri/examples/examples\_merge\_from\_raw\_files\_with\_post\_demosaicing.ipynb}{Jupyter Notebook}.

\end{itemize}
\paragraph{References}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/colour_demosaicing.demosaicing_CFA_Bayer_DDFAPD:id1}}{\hyperref[\detokenize{bibliography:menon2007c}]{\sphinxcrossref{{[}MAC07{]}}}}

\end{itemize}

\PYG{g+gp}{... }    \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{[} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.30980393}\PYG{p}{,}  \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.36078432}\PYG{p}{,}  \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.30588236}\PYG{p}{,}  \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.3764706} \PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\chapter{Contributing}
\label{\detokenize{index:contributing}}
If you would like to contribute to \sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour-demosaicing}{Colour - Demosaicing},
please refer to the following \sphinxhref{http://colour-science.org/contributing/}{Contributing}
guide for \sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour}{Colour}.

\label{\detokenize{index:bibliography}}
The bibliography is available in the repository in
\sphinxhref{https://github.com/colour-science/colour-demosaicing/blob/develop/BIBLIOGRAPHY.bib}{BibTeX}
format.

\begin{sphinxthebibliography}{MHCW04}
\bibitem[LMY10]{\detokenize{LMY10}}{\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{bibliography:losson2010c}} 
O. Losson, L. Macaire, and Y. Yang. Comparison of Color Demosaicing Methods. In \sphinxstyleemphasis{Advances in Imaging and Electron Physics}, volume 162, pages 173\textendash{}265. 2010. }
